comment: This professor clearly has a Napoleon complex and probably is a narcissist. The laziest professor I have ever had to deal with. He just uses content from other people and does it really show any originality. Big talker, but just that, a talker. I don't see why any university would want to have someone like this as a professor.

Probably the worst professor I have had.  He treats the class as though it's an inconvenience for him.  Sends emails every Friday reminding you not to contact him over the weekend, yet his assignments are due on Sundays.  The class is in total chaos, his exams have nothing to do with the modules from class at all.  Try to avoid if possible.

He is a good professor if you do not have any issues like I did. The assignments are laid out at the beginning of the course and if you turn them in on time you should not have any issues. I had to look around for this professor's name because he does not communicate too much throughout the semester. Overall his class was easy

Typical online professor. He makes announcements about exams sometimes. He leaves feedback on almost all lab assignments which he definitely goes out of his way to do, and answers any questions you leave on your document as well as corrections to things you may have done wrong. He also just compliments answers he thinks are good, which is nice.

Do not be fooled by the good reviews. This professor was terrible, hardly communicated the whole course, cancelled most of our assignments, and even got upset with the class for contacting the department chair. Save yourself and avoid any courses taught by this man.

Foster Scotland SUCKED as professor of my online course this summer. Quick to call students entitled, warned us not to "whine every time things do not go your way" (exact quote). Kept saying he "might" change course material and cancel big assignments, then never confirming. Created 0 of the course content. Class was easy A, prof made it terrible.

Professor got caught between a rock and a hard place with this course. My guess is that he was made to teach the course last-minute, but I digress. He's doing his best to make it work and is constantly giving updates on his progress with grading assignments. Workload isn't bad; labs are straightforward and the research paper wasn't that bad.

It is 100% clear that Mr. Scotland is a placeholder professor for this course because none of the material is his but from a professor who built the course. He does not follow the syllabus guidelines for grading, and he does not communicate with the class effectively. I would advise against taking one of his classes, if you can.
Enjoyed the class. Responds to emails quickly. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him definitely do.

I can not explain to you how much I hate this professor. Absolutely horrible. He is unorganized, doesn't care about his students and the course is filled with mistakes. He checked out on the class towards the end with so many unanswered emails. Please don't fall for the "good" reviews. Do NOT take him!

Prof. Scotland is nice and helped me with tech issues. He's more of a facilitator - answers emails promptly and passes out 100s. No weekly quizzes, 8 labs/reports, open-book (and super easy) midterm, and no final. Great class for an easy A, but take another section to really learn something.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: If you just want to graduate/get a good grade and dont care to learn about the class, take him. But if you actually want to learn and have legitimate feedback on the class/grades, avoid him. Dude never participated in the class. He only uses a template that the school gave him and then just gives 100s at the end of the semester.

Easiest class Ive taken at KSU and its a 4000 level. Every assignment is step by step tutorial and theres no way you cant get a 100 on all of them. The midterm is questions online so you cant not get a 100 in this class. Im taking this professor again if I can
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Prof. Scotland was almost completely absent for the entire semester. All communication went unanswered the entire semester. None of the assignments or discussions were graded until the end of the term and he obviously just went through and assigned all 100's. So at least I got a 100 in the class I guess. I would never take his class again.

This was my first class with Professor Scotland and I wish I had a chance to take one of his classes sooner! The quizzes were really straight forward in this class, the two exams didn't have any surprises. All were basically on the knowledge in the material, no 'outside surprises' He also gives feedback regularly and grades promptly.
If you are able to, take this professor. He is amazing and is able to teach you things for real world use as well.
If you are busy with work and daily life and are taking online classes. Take this professor! His class is easy and long as you do the work, you will get a A!

Had this professor in an online class. He's very responsive and seems to grade as quickly as he can. He gives good feedback. I can't speak to his actual teaching style as all the material was PDF'd, but the content in those PDFs was great.
Very engaging, uses real world examples, and very willing to assist as well as offers great advise.
Good professor
Great lecture. I had A + in this class. Love to take him again and again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Really enjoyed his class. He's one of the best professors I've had thus far, he doesn't read everything off of the PowerPoints like almost every other professor and what he teaches is engaging and interesting. Reading the book will help you understand more of the material as well.

If you have any opportunity to take Mr Scotland you definitely should. Some fellow classmates complain they didnt learn anything because generally his lectures are more informal. However, if you follow the assignment guidelines and do the required reading you learn a lot as well as getting amazing lectures.

This professor was working full time, teaching this class, and working towards his PhD all at the same time. He did not respond to my emails even when I sent them to his non-ksu email address that he preferred. I dropped the class for fear of not understanding something and not being able to get a response.

The professor was great in getting the message across and getting the students engaged in the assignments. They were not boring, and required research but during that time you will learn a few things here and there. As long as you read the lectures and do the assignments this is an easy class.

My second time in this course. Material on tests come more from the slides than the book, which means you don't have to rely solely on the book. Scotland is a considerate professor and a fair grader. He will give you a chance, so long as you don't abuse his goodwill. Pay attention to deadlines and turn everything in; you will get a good grade.

Decent professor. I did learn some things in class (that were outside of the curriculum) so that is a plus. Prof Scotty knows a little about lots of things, but nothing you could dive in deep on. Still recommended given the caliber of teachers teaching at KSU. Easy A and very flexible.
The dude is good. What more do I need to say?
I really enjoyed taking his class. He allowed us to start our labs in class so we could ask questions if needed.

Professor Scotland is the man. Lectures were never dull and he was always will to answer questions, even if they were off topic. Always incorporated real-life experience into the teachings to make it relatable and got the class involved. While attendance is not required, we almost always had a full room because his lectures were that interesting

If I could take him again, I would. My appreciation of him comes from pushing me to learn real world application outside of class. When I first started his class, I did not know much in-terms of IT. By the time the semester was over, I felt extremely confident to enter the workforce at level higher than entry or intern.

This is my favorite professor so far at KSU. I actually looked forward to going to his lectures because I learned things that will be relevant outside of the classroom. It's hard to de-Bob Brown a class but I believe Professor Scotland did an awesome job at bettering the class.

Professor Scotland provides an outstanding view of the Infosec reality that we have right outside our door. He has a wide range of experience that he brings into the classroom for us to see what we have to look forward to (or not, in some cases), what to look out for, and how to step into the professional world of IT. Great professor!

Great Professor. Really wants you to learn. Very flexible as long as you don't take advantage. Learned a lot from this class. Very responsive when you reach out to him. I would recommend him all day long.
Fantastic professor. As long as you care enough and show some effort he will make sure you learn what you need to. Also lots of good stories and outside of the course lessons.

Not much reading to be honest. He makes the class fun. Read the syllabus to truly get in contact with him. Professor Scotland is highly knowledgeable in his field. Professor Scotland does everything in class to make assignments, quizzes and tests understandable

Professor Scotland is probably one of the best Teachers at KSU. He makes it readily apparent he cares about not only how he teaches the Material but what the material is in the first place. Take him if you want to actively learn, pass if you just want the credit because he's wasted on you.

Mr Scotland best Professor i ever get in my IT major. hes so good helpful caring . he teach us the things that r matter in real word lead us to the right path he always gives the best advise my best professor
Professor Scotland was a great professor. He was a fair grader and made you want to learn. His class was very enjoyable.
He is the best prof i have had in my entire time at KSU. if you do your work and you will pass. he is always available to help.

You wont come accross any professor better than him . His lectures are usually fun and  interesting. he always relates things from the text to real life. He wants his students to pass and also learn but you must do your assignments and you will be good for an A. We need more professors like him in college.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Homework policy was a very strict.

Professor Scotland is one of the BEST professors I've had at SPSU/KSU. This guy gets it, and just wants you to understand the material. He grades very fairly, and always leaves useful feedback. If you miss a lab, or do poorly on a test, he'll reach out to you, and will work with you to help get you back on track. I also took  him for Wireless Sec.
Professor Scotland is helpful and easy going professor. He is always ready to help and answer email quickly. Recommended.

Professor Scotland is great and hilarious! The material in this class is super outdated so he tried his best to incorporate recent information. He will respond back to you quickly through email. He will also help you with any problems. I highly recommend him!
Professor Scotland is awesome! He answers you quickly if you email him and he will work with you if you have a problem. He is very knowledgeable as well.
Professor Scotland is a great professor. He's very helpful and he genuinely wants you to do well in his class and in life. He also give great advice about the IT field.
Ptofessor Scotland is great! I really enjoyed his classes and he was always very helpful when I emailed him. I would take him again if he teaches another class I need.
Professor Foster Scotland is the best and very comprehensive when you are having problems following up with the class.
Great professor and he responds quickly to emails.
